website_summaries.verdict: Although pricey, these smart, dimmable bulbs appeal to people with smart homes.
pros: Great for indoor/outdoor use and smart home applications
The plastic globe is cooler to the touch than traditional glass bulbs
cons: Doesn't connect easily to some smart systems
Light may be brighter and whiter than expected

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: After a firmware update a few months ago, the bulbs now flicker on/off randomly at all hours of the day. I have waited more than enough time for Cree to resolve the issue. Unfortunately, my spouse is getting angrier at me by the day, so I'm replacing all of these bulbs with another brand. The money I spent on these has been wasted. UPDATE: It turns out the Cree light bulbs were also breaking all of the other ZigBee devices in my network. Previously, all of my SmartThings buttons and sensors kept becoming "Unavailable" at random intervals. However, this issue ceased after I replaced all of my Cree bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Randomly flash on with latest firmware
customer_reviews.text: One star right now. I've had these for almost 2 years and they've been great but they got a firmware upgrade in October and have been flashing randomly. The company has been quiet and said nothing. 100% run away if buying for smartthings. I'm giving up and replacing them.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Snelling

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with dimmer switch. Only gets somewhat dim.
customer_reviews.text: I like these bulbs a lot! I've been getting them at clearance prices for $6-7 apiece and they're very good for that price. They are brighter than Hue bulbs. They can connect to the Hue app. The downsides are that they don't get as dim as the Hue bulbs (at its lowest, it's about equal to Hue at 25%). And something written in small text on the box, and NOT MENTIONED IN THE AMAZON DESCRIPTION, is that you can't put these bulbs on a dimmer switch. They can only be dimmed from a command from your phone, alexa, etc. When I put them on a dimmer switch, they flickered really badly at most settings between "full on" and "fully dimmed"
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Lasted almost 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought 10 of these bulbs for a great price. When they worked, they worked OK. This past week, almost 9 months from when I bought them, we had two situations where our electricity went off momentarily. The first time it happened, 6 of these bulbs could not be found by Alexa...even after resetting the bulbs to factory settings and starting over. The second time, we lost the other 4 bulbs. All 10 still work, but only as stand-alone non-dimmable bulbs that will not connect to Alexa. Once again, these bulbs have taught me you get what you pay for. Definitely would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: No cheaper option to fully control a standard light via Alexa etc.
customer_reviews.text: These are your cheapest option to make any standard lamp into an Alexa dimmable and fully controllable. When used in rooms, through the app, "turn off the light" will turn it off in the room your Alexa of in. Using routines you can control multiple bulbs. They dim from 5 percent and no flicker... Bypass Alexa by turning the light off and back on. Mine were the zigbee version that works great with smartthings.
customer_reviews.author: James Bushey

customer_reviews.title: Distance connection issue
customer_reviews.text: Trouble connecting to Smartthings Hub. Realize the distance between outdoor bulb and smartthing hub was too far apart. Plugged in the bulb to a light fixture inside the house and it connected fine. Once connected to both Smartthings hub and Alexa, the plugged the bulb to my outside light fixture and all settings we still set & worked.
customer_reviews.author: austin ung

customer_reviews.title: The perfect light bulb!
customer_reviews.text: I've just bought my 4th Cree Connected bulb. They're perfect to use where you don't want to fool with modules or special switches. The 60W bulbs give off very good, bright light but it's not the weird, eerie glow you get with some bulbs We find that we usually keep them dimmed but it's nice knowing we can tell Alexa to turn them up when we need it! I have these bulbs paired with my SmartThings hub and Alexa. Some of the lights are scheduled to turn on or go off at different times and the bulbs handle it very well. I'll definitely keep buying these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: LGT Lilburn

customer_reviews.title: Working great after three years
customer_reviews.text: At the time of this writing, I will have had seven of these bulbs for a little over three years. I connected them to my SmartThings hub and control them with several Google Mini's. They turn on and off without any issues and dim nicely with voice commands. They have worked flawlessly over the years and are still going strong. These bulbs were a great addition to my ever evolving smart home and I would purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my SmartThings v2 hub and my Echo
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my SmartThings v2 hub and my Echo. Quick to respond, and provide a nice light. I've replaced most of my bulbs with these now. If you're having problems getting your bulbs to work, make sure you're not setting them up with a lamp that has a dimmer or three-way settings. I spent way too long before I realized the lamp I was using to set them up was a three way switch, and even turning it all the way up didn't work. After moving it to a straight up on/off switch, they instantly started working.
customer_reviews.author: J. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Good bulbs, connectivity is not the best
customer_reviews.text: I have had six of these bulbs for about 3 years. The only issue I have is with distance from the hub; if you can’t centrally locate your hub you may have a problem with getting the bulbs to connect or stay connected. I have this issue. If you have many Zigbee devices this will work better as it creates its own network. I won’t buy any more of these based on this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Den Asbury

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, and the price is right!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these bulbs installed in the welcome lamps on my front patio, and 2 installed in my headboard. They're all linked to a Wink Hub 2 in my office, and scheduled to turn on and off at sunset and sunrise, respectively. It's been several months, and I'm very pleased. They stay connected as long as my wifi is up. Toggles/dimming/manual commands happen pretty immediately. No annoying buzz when dimmed. There's *is* a little weirdness in the app - it shows the 2 front bulbs in disconnected status; but all the functionality still works (I can still toggle and dim, etc) so I haven't bothered to troubleshoot it.
customer_reviews.author: Squarehead Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great for automatic porch light
customer_reviews.text: Love them, such an easy way to get smart lighting without installing a smart switch. I’m using these bulbs in our outdoor light fixtures (carport and back door), and I have them grouped and scheduled (with a Wink router) to turn on at sunset and off at sunrise. It’s done so much for the curb appeal, hopefully helped with security, and I never have to think about it. I’m picky about light color, didn’t want it to look blue or institutional, and these look like classic incandescent bulbs BUT SMART.
customer_reviews.author: charlotte eloise

customer_reviews.title: Work well but will fail after a couple years
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had about 20 of these bulbs that I bought on Amazon and the Home Depot over the last couple years. They work great for about that much time and then they start failing. One by one they start flashing dimly when in the off state or no longer turning off completely. Most of them will sit at 10% brightness when set to off. They still function, but not being able to turn off the lights at night is a deal breaker, so I have to replace them now.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Very bright.  Better light coverage.
customer_reviews.text: Integrated these into existing Phillips Hue hub and worked great (read other comments on how to successfuly do thiS or google it). These are Very bright and i moved the phillips bulbs from our reading table and are using these now. Much happier with these for reading. They perform as advertised and having zero issues with them. Will be buying more later.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Samosa

customer_reviews.title: Original bulb only lasted ~2 years, but good customer service saved the day
customer_reviews.text: Update 01/25/19: I reached out to Cree customer service, and they sent me a new bulb quickly to replace the failed one. I've installed it and it seems to work fine. Adding 2 stars for the good customer service and standing behind their product. If it lasts longer than the original, I'll bump it up another. Original Review: Worked great until it didn't. I bought this light bulb Nov '16 and it only lasted until Dec '18 with only occasional use. These should last a lot longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: gj

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Bulbs were fine for a while however they are extremely susceptible to power fluctuations. If you happen to lose power or turn of the light switch connected to the bulb more than once in a short time they will disconnect from the hub and the zigbee chip will be damaged. They become very expensive dumb LED bulbs after that. The reset process for these can also be cumbersome as they require 2 sec on and 2 sec off which needs to be precise. Side note I highly recommend having a whole house surge protector installed on any smart bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great smart bulb for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a lot of smart bulbs that cost way more money and didn't work with my wink hub.. This light bulb works great with my wink hub! Easy set up and excellent price and quality. Highly recommend this bulb! Amazon prime is so awesome.. I ordered #1 bulb and it was on my porch less than 48 hours later! One light bulb!!!! Stellar service! No one can beat them!
customer_reviews.author: Sherrell

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Cree is a North Carolina company (my home state and where I live) so I wanted to give these a try. So far, after about a month, they work great! I have them on my outside deck and have them set to automatically set through my Echo Show (with hub) to come on at sunset at 1% and turn off at sunrise. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Integrates well with Echo Plus
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to work with my Echo Plus and they work great. Just a note that it took some trial and error, but learned that it took a "reset" of the bulb before the Alexa app would recognize the bulb. This is pretty easy, you just need to switch it on for a second, and switch it off for two seconds--and repeat this three times. The third time the light bulb will be "reset". Hit the discover button the app, and then turn the bulb on. It will dim for a moment and then continue to be added to your devices in the app.
customer_reviews.author: EG Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect
customer_reviews.text: first one I was sent would turn on but after hours of resetting it and retrying it wouldn't connect to my hub. I got a replacement and that one had the same issue. I returned both.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Flood

customer_reviews.title: Working perfectly fine
customer_reviews.text: Installed the bulbs in basement. After installing, pairing was a breeze using smartthings hub. After pairing, was able to use smartthings, to setup rules for switching the bulbs on and off. Installation, pairing and usage was fairly easy using smarthings hub (will image the same using other hubs). Light bulb is as bright as I thought it would be! There are other bulbs that were rated higher than this but I had bought and used this bulb previously and it works for me. So I bought it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ganapathy Iyer

customer_reviews.title: So far, for the price and ease of use, I like them.
customer_reviews.text: So far I like these bulbs for the price. I had a very slight learning curve with the learn process but nothing major. I would advise when learning into the echo plus to enroll very close to it and power cycle the bulb a few times if it doesn't work the first time. Now to like live with them for a while and see how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Was a pain but I managed to pair it with hue (use touchlink), Feb 2018
customer_reviews.text: I tried the recommended way of using the hue app and searching, then adding by serial number. I found an Android app called hue essentials that used an old hue protocol to connect them, basically you tell it to use touching and press the button on the hue bridge while it's searching. The Android apps name was hue essentials. It was in beta and tbh not sure why I picked that one from the app store. But it worked. I suspect any app that can get it to use touchlink will work.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Ugly bulb that doesn't remember it's brightness setting after power cycle.
customer_reviews.text: This bulb is pretty ugly, you really can't use it in many lamps or vanity/sconces. Also should not be used in damp conditions due to it's open design, bugs would also get in there and it just isn't a great design. The final straw is this: doesn't remember it's brightness setting if power cycles. Have to return this bulb
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb from a great company
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are great! They paired fairly easy with my Echo Plus (which has a zigbee hub built in). The trick with these bulbs is to start discovery on your hub and THEN turn the bulb on to be discovered. I have eight of these bulbs and they all paired and turn off and on and dim as expected.
customer_reviews.author: A. Person

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect to SmartThings Hub. One (of 6) didn't light at all.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 6. One of them did not light at all. The other 5 couldn't be connected to my SmartThings hub. (Were not recognized by the hub, and if they had a serial number to add them manually, I sure couldn't find it). Replaced them with Philips Hue bulbs, which are a bit more expensive, but connect painlessly.
customer_reviews.author: A. Holub

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but won't work with Amazon Echo
customer_reviews.text: Nice light bulb, very light weight, unlike some of the competition. One downside is that at this time (May 2016) it won't work with Amazon Echo voice control. It can be controlled via the Hue app, or other apps, but there is some bug preventing Echo from recognizing these particular bulbs via the Hue hub (although it recognizes others). It is not exactly clear whether the issue is on the Cree side or the Echo side (some technical comments from other reviewers seem to suggest the latter), but at the end of the day the fact remains, and the two won't work together. That makes it a maximum of only 4 stars in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: 12 for 12 Successfully Paired, Great Lights!
customer_reviews.text: Easy as pie to set up with the new Echo Plus. Installed 12 of these in various overhead fixtures, nightstand lamps, etc. Not a single bulb out of two 6 packs failed to pair or gave me any issues at all. Easy to set up into groups with the Alexa smart home groups feature. Only gripe (has to be something, right?) is that dimming leaves something to be desired. Even dimmed to literally 1%, they throw much more light than my BR30 LED can lights at their lowest setting. But still, overall great performance and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Paul K.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good light connected to SmartThings
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good little light. I installed it, turned it on and SmartThings instantly saw it. Everything connected and programmed easier than expected and the light is nice and bright. Very responsive and I am happy to say there is no flicker at any brightness level.
customer_reviews.author: KAEAM

customer_reviews.title: Re-Pair Often...
customer_reviews.text: This bulb is very fickle. I bought 4 of these and had to replace 2 that would not pair with my SmartThings Hub. Amazon quickly replaced the two that didn't work, but now (several months later), I find myself having to reset the bulbs and re-pair them to my hub almost monthly. I have 10+ GE bulbs that work great and never lose connection. Cree bulbs are subpar in comparison. Not sure how much longer I'll try to keep them paired, but I'm getting really tired of having to pair them every month.
customer_reviews.author: bccoley

customer_reviews.title: Works with SmartThings 👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Figured we would give this a try. Have been using timers throughout the house for years & always dreaded time change process on multiple lights. Started with the SmartThings hub & the GE-Z wave products, and they have worked flawlessly. Saw this on Amazon and figured why not. Paired quickly with SmartThings & has been working for months perfectly. Definitely recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: K R

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Affordable Smart Bulbs - Especially in Soft White
customer_reviews.text: Love these Cree bulbs. The Soft White version is so much more appealing than the Daylight ones. They operate smoothly and work with Amazon's Echo. They cast a very normal looking light pattern unlike the majority of other bulbs of this type that cast most of their light upward or have visible banding in the light cast on the walls and things around them. I'm very pleased, but... Even though these are reported to be some of the brightest of these bulbs available, I wish that I could get some brighter ones still. Especially since they are dimmable.
customer_reviews.author: vrdaver

customer_reviews.title: Works great with SmartThings!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these bulbs for my SmartThings setup. Didn't want to spend a bundle on a Phillips Hue system. Was a little skeptical given the relatively older Zigbee technology and how it would pair with the SmartThings hub. Was blown away by how easy installation was. ST picked it up immediately. Was able to integrate it into my lighting protocols that are paired with my motion sensors and door sensors. Worked flawlessly after installation. No software tweaks required. Ordered 5 more to use in the rest of my home.
customer_reviews.author: AK30882

customer_reviews.title: Cree Connected 60W Equivalent Soft White bulbs
customer_reviews.text: It took seconds for the bulb to integrate with Alex. I have been using the bulbs for the past few years. I like the fact that these bulbs are less expensive than the big named company bulbs. I will be getting more bulbs in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Nos4nusTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb if you have a zigbee hub
customer_reviews.text: Great zigbee bulb. Will work fine with a normal light switch, but if you have a zigbee hub like smartthings you can also control the dimming from your phone. Get Google Home or Amazon Alexa in addition to the hub and you can control it with your voice. I'd suggest putting your hub in search mode before plugging this in for the first time. Putting this in pairing mode after you've been using it is kinda weird, but I was able to get it paired pretty easily once I read the directions. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a smart dimmable bulb that is fairly reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I use Smartthingshub... They integrate OK. A little painful to set up multiple bulbs. Have to switch them on and off a few times and can only do one bulb at a time. I wish the on/off status was more reliable. Sometimes the bulb will get turned on by smartthings -- then someone flips a switch. The status never updates in smartthings. So if I'm out of the house, I think the bulb is still on. This is probably more of a zigby issue or smartthings issue than an issue with the bulb. Overall, this is a good price for a smart dimmable bulb that is fairly reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: I really like these!
customer_reviews.text: I bought over a dozen of these. They work well with my Amazon Echo PLUS. You need the plus for the zigbee hub. Time will tell if they are durable. But they work great with the Echo Plus.
customer_reviews.author: Bob W

customer_reviews.title: NOT z-wave plus compatible NOT NOT NOT.
customer_reviews.text: Despite showing up in search results for z-wave plus bulbs, these are not z-wave plus compatible. They will NOT work with HomeSeer systems, or z-wave plus.
customer_reviews.author: Qtr_Note

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many brands of LED bulbs and gave up on them because none lasted more than a year. The only LED bulb I have ever had last longer than a year is Cree... so I bought these and a few months later the Cree is still working. I will stay with Cree bulbs now and not bother with other brands anymore. These bulbs work awesome with my SmartThings hub and also Amazon Alexa. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: VelocityTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and bright better then the spiral led that I tried first even though I think they are both rated 60 watt. It also stays very cool which is what I need because it's in a ceiling light and the bulb touches the globe.
customer_reviews.author: Edie

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite smart bulbs, and the are Dimmable
customer_reviews.text: I love these bulbs... Easy to connect to my Wink home smart hub, and they work perfectly with Amazon Echo ( Alexa)... The best feature... They are completely dimmable ... Yeah, finally, and at a reasonable price. Some of the other Dimmable smart bulbs out there are ridiculously expensive. I bought extras, and now I can have my Amazon Echo (Alexa) turn lights on / off.. I've grouped some as well. How did we ever function prior to this technology.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Not dimmable via traditional switch!
customer_reviews.text: Bulbs are not dimmable via standard dimmer switch on your wall, only via smart hub. They buzz loudly in a standard fixture with a dimmer switch. I’m sad sad sad because I adore the look with the little cutouts that cast a soft pattern on the ceiling, and it appears that Cree no longer makes a bulb that looks like that in a non-smart-home format.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great smart bulbs!
customer_reviews.text: And I thought setting up a smart house would be hard! I bought these because someone recommended them in a review for another product. I'm glad I did! They're much less expensive than other bulbs, but work great. I screwed them in, and my Wink 2 hub found them immediately. Alexa turns them on/off and dims them--immediately. No buzzing, flashing, heat, etc. The light is perfect--bright, but not glaring. I just bought some more, for other fixtures. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: JoLynn Oten

customer_reviews.title: Annoying to set up, but works great
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues getting it to sync with my Echo Plus, but afterwards, works like a charm. Hopefully Cree will get it to work a little better, but otherwise, no real issues here.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B

customer_reviews.title: Pairs with Hue and MUCH cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value, nice soft light, and pairs easily with Phillips Hue (once you figure out the tick). To pair these with Hue, you need to turn the lamp OFF, begin the search in the Hue App, and turn the bulb ON during the search. Finds them every time.
customer_reviews.author: Radio Man

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with smartthings hub
customer_reviews.text: Bought these bulbs to put in wall sconces in bedroom and to integrate with Samsung SmartThings. Works absolutely great. Integration with smartthings and Google Assistant was easy. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: William T.

customer_reviews.title: One of the cheapest smart bulb you can find
customer_reviews.text: One of the cheapest smart bulb you can find. Due to the new zigbee electricity meter (made by iTron) installed by local utility company, it interferes and makes connecting this bulb with the hub very difficult. If you're having issue pairing this with your hub, try move the hub directly above the light bulb and use aluminum sheet to shield them together. Find more pairing instructions by googling "Issues Connecting with Cree Connected Bulbs"
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: say NO
customer_reviews.text: These are so dull it's not even funny. I put these in my ceiling fan in a bedroom which takes 60 watts max and these made a very annoying humming sound when turned on. If the Tv is not on to drown out the humming sound, it's extremely annoying. Then theres the brightness... Well its just not bright at all. Even at night, they actually cannot be the only light on because it is not bright enough. I would never buy something from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected flashing!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two bulbs to work with the amazon echo plus. The bulbs work with voice commands to Alexa, as expected. But the bulbs have an unpleasant feature. A few times an hour, while off, the flash on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Yeoman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: You need to put these bulbs in seldom used light switched. Wink - the controller - says that you should only control the lights thru your phone. I forget and use the switched still and it throws the system off. That is the only glitch though - otherwise they work well. dimming lights that are not on dimmers and turning on and off when I am away
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: A Great Purchase for a Smart House
customer_reviews.text: I bought this light to add to my Samsung SmartThings hub and it's become the perfect bedside light. The syncing process is seamless (can't speak to syncing to any other Smart Hub other than SmartThings) and almost immediate. I use it with my Amazon Echo and the voice command process is a breeze. It's great for keeping on and for most of the time in my bedroom it is the only light that I have on. I plan on ordering more for the rest of my house!
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great light! Great Automation Option
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to replacing outlets or buying the plug adaptors. I use this with SmartThings and it works great. It turns on at sunset and I turn it off with alexa. The light color is a wonderfully pleasantly warm light perfect for the bedroom or a living area. The light dispersion is also wonderful it is not a typical led that throws a lot of light up it also places a fair amount downward.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: "Alexa, lights on!"
customer_reviews.text: I use it with my Amazon Echo. I use a Philips Hue Bridge, v 1. I am slowly replacing lights with these so that I can use "Alexa" to turn on, dim, and turn off the most frequently used lights. Gotta love technology.
customer_reviews.author: Matpr

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs, very bright
customer_reviews.text: These are far brighter than the Lightify bulbs I am replacing. Work find on the lightify hub and the hue hub. Easy to pair. My Lightify bulbs all started dying after 1 year, so they are being replaced with these as it happens. Casts plenty of light through a lamp shade.
customer_reviews.author: Rob BTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: Best bulb for value and performance.
customer_reviews.text: I love the price, I hope they still make this when I need another bulb for something else. I am pretty sure this is dimmable. I had many problems with other bulbs. Some burned really hot. I love these.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: the greatest- these bulbs will spoil you instantly
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of these Cree Connect Bulbs, I have them in every lamp in my home and they can be controlled through iphone, alexa, or smart things app for automated shut on/off. You get used to automated lights immediately- very spoiling. also good for safety. Highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: tx reader

customer_reviews.title: Great for automation
customer_reviews.text: Reliable and works well with Smartthings and Alexa. Note that you cannot switch these off and on from a regular switch. It must be installed in an always on socket and controlled by an app or other controller. I mention it as my wife keeps trying to turn this on and off from the wall switch!
customer_reviews.author: Nutner

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty slow to turn on and off
customer_reviews.text: When you have a few other wifi bulbs that turn off almost instantly and see this one take a little longer, it really sticks out. I don't really know all the different characteristics to consider when reviewing light bulbs I'll choose reponsivness as one. It's pretty slow to turn on and off. It's almost as if this light has a setting where it doesn't go instant off or on. It dims all the way up or down.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Smart bulbs
customer_reviews.text: The cree smart bulbs are great. I’ve had two outside by the garage. They have worked for well over 4 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I bought a pack of 5 ONLY 3 HAD LIGHTS IN THEM!!
customer_reviews.text: So I only got 3 of the 5 lights I purchased. When I first got these in December I opened the first box that had a bulb and installed it. I didn't need the other 4 right away. Well, today when I went to install the rest I realized that I only had a total of 3, not 5. Two boxes were empty! Of course, it is outside the return window!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: That one guy

customer_reviews.title: Got 25 bulbs and have had 0 issues
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs were on sale and I wanted to replace all the bulbs in my house with connected bulbs. I received 25 bulbs and have had them installed for since Feb 2020 with no issues. They paired up seamlessly with my Hue bridge (v2) through the official app, and so far they're working great! Light temperature is bright, but very slightly warm (yellow). I will update this review if any problems arise.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Economical and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing this bulb monthly, as a subscribe and save item. It is an economical way to replace your bulbs with white smart bulbs. Once in a while I have a problem reconnecting the bulbs but I believe it is because of the smart home product I used. I recently changed and have not had any disconnects. There is one bulb I have that I just could not reset, even trying the basic instructions and another trick I read about but that was the only bulb I had issues with and it could have something to do with it being on a pull chain fixture.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Baker

customer_reviews.title: Unrecognized by Samsung SmartThings Hub
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 bulbs. They work fine as a standard bulb, but they refuse to be recognized by the SmartThings Hub. I have several non-Cree devices and they all work fine so it's not the hub. Even tried pairing them within 3 feet of the hub in case it was a distance issue. No Joy. Too late to send back. Absolute junk!
customer_reviews.author: G. Wilterdink

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easily pairs with Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: First light I have ordered that I was easily able to pair with Alexa and no hub required. LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Egam

customer_reviews.title: Does not work without an additional hub!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these light bulbs to use with my Alexa and they won’t work unless I purchase an additional hub. Very very disappointed. I’ve tried for months now to get them to work and now it’s to late to send them back. False advertising!!
customer_reviews.author: A Barbe

customer_reviews.title: Works with Wemo
customer_reviews.text: I use this with the Wemo light hub. I ran into a bit of an issue when first trying to add it to my Wemo system until I read this particular brand often needs to be very near the hub/base when first connected to be recognized. My hub is in the living room so I added this bulb to my table lamp. Once it was recognized, I was able to rename it in my system and relocate it to the bedroom. I have had no issues since then. This is a great addition to my current lighting system which works with Wemo and IFFTT to allow hands free light control with Alexa!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Integrates with my SmartThings hub. I like that I can set the dimmer level even on a lamp that doesn't have that feature, since it's within the bulb itself. I've got 3 of these bulbs now and they are all perfect. Setup was easy but it wasn't totally automatic; I had to choose the device my SmartThings hub was searching for. After that it was a breeze. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Great Connected Bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Cree Connected Bulbs are great for the Smart Home. Syncing to Smartthings and using with my Amazon Echo works best with these bulbs. I have Osram Tunable Lightfy Bulbs and those give me the most trouble. Sometimes they get disconnected and the temperature I have it set at resets back to 2700k randomly. I'm so glad Cree came out with a 2700k and 5000k version for their connected LED bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Thanh

customer_reviews.title: Remotely controlled bulbs.
customer_reviews.text: Thee work well with Lutrons "remote connected" switch but they have top be programmed separately from other bulbs. Presently they only have 60W equivalent "connected" LED bulbs in 2700K and I believe 5000 K. I prefer the 3000K bulb which most closely represents a halogen bulb. When I last checked, these bulbs only came in 60W equivalent.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbo
customer_reviews.text: These will not pair with Smartthings any more. Also, they emit a loud buzzing. These used to be some of the better led smart bulbs, what happened?
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bezos

customer_reviews.title: As-advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Setup was incredibly easy. I have my own hub (Almond Router). All I had to do was start pairing on the hub, then turn the bulb on. The color is definitely a soft white and it's sufficiently bright. There is no pairing button, and no manual brightness adjustment button. For that you'll need a different bulb. This has the basics and looks good at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Buy these!!
customer_reviews.text: Love our cree bulbs. We have 16 synced to both the Echo and Samsung smart hub. They are capable of producing tremendous light and easily dim to get the perfect setting. They sync easily for anyone who can operate a smart phone..####update!!! First one failed today. It didn’t last 2 years. I’m not happy about it. But if it’s just one out of the many, I guess it’s okay. We’ll see how the rest will do.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with Wink hub.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to connect and setup with a Wink hub. Cheap solution in lieu of buying a smart switch if it's a light that you want to function with a regular on/off schedule - I use this for a front porch light set to turn on at dusk and off and dawn, so I just leave the switch that powers it on all the time.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install with Wink II
customer_reviews.text: They work great with the Wink Hub 2, instead of replacing the wall switch just put in the bulb. I hopes it will last forever, at 14 bucks a pop maybe in 2 years I will regret not just having replaced the wall switch instead. I hope to report back when that happens. But so far way easier and it works. whish they had 100W ones and 38PAR type too.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Connection goes bad after time
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these light bulbs, not all at once, but over time. And over time, each and every one of these have lost connection to the hub. (Samsung Smartthing Hub) I have reset the bulbs, reconnected and they lose connection over time. After several tries of resetting, some of the bulbs don't even seem to reset anymore. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works perfect with Amazon Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. It works perfect with Amazon Alexa using WINK HUB. It has dimmer. I look perfect in my IKEA lamp.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Subero

customer_reviews.title: Good bulb. Won't go as dim as Hue bulbs.
customer_reviews.text: Works with Hue Bridge. A little different to sync with the bridge than the normal Hue bulbs. You have to turn the light switch to off, then hit search on the Hue app. Then you have to turn the light switch on for it to be detected. The bulb itself doesn't get as dim as the white Hue bulbs, but for a cheaper option it works really well. I will. It more for some of the places I don't really care about being dimmable as much.
customer_reviews.author: UnknownX11

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Installed in front door light fixture. Connected to my Samsung SmartThings hub. Turns on dusk, off at 2am. I had to reset the bulb before it would actually pair with the hub. I assume this is because I bought this bulb used and it was still associated with another hub. The reset procedure was quite easy and well documented on Samsung's site.
customer_reviews.author: mnmike

customer_reviews.title: Glad to support cross-compatible products (this one works with Hue ...
customer_reviews.text: Glad to support cross-compatible products (this one works with Hue hubs), but pairing these to a Hue hub is tricky. Requires third-party software. Have 7 or so in my home, though, and they work well. The Hue bulbs have a significantly lower minimum brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can no connect to Wink.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a two pack of these light bulbs back in April 2019 they worked fine for about two months. I had them connected to my Wink hub. When the Wink hub did an update I could no longer get them to connect to the hub again. In all fairness this might be a Wink problem but I do not have a problem connecting my GE bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: James K.

customer_reviews.title: Don' connect if you have a smart utility meter with ZigBee protocol, other brand bulbs do.
customer_reviews.text: Beware if you have a smart utility meter that speaks ZigBee protocol. You can NOT connect these bulbs in that situation. The meter responds incorrectly when trying to connect to the bulb and doesn't allow the bulb to connect. I'm using a SmartThings Hub which is very common as it's pretty much the best product for the purpose. Other bulbs, Osram for example work just fine and cost about the same. The Osram bulbs are also much more attractive. The Cree bulbs look kind of junky, IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Stine

customer_reviews.title: Cree Bulbs are Reliable and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I always loo for CREE before opting for another brand. Please start making 75w & 100W equivalents
customer_reviews.author: Larry S.

customer_reviews.title: Great smart bulb
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to pair with smart things picked it up right away. And it's a bright bulb a very good 60 or 75 watt replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Raudsep

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb
customer_reviews.text: It's a great bulb overall, connected very easily to my Wink Hub. My biggest problem with it? The color temperature. Prior to installing these in my living room and bedroom, I had 3000K lights and I really liked the color and color reproduction of items in my rooms. I find 2700K to be an odd choice of temperature but I'm sure Cree have their reasons for it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Foshee

customer_reviews.title: Good quality basic white smart bulb
customer_reviews.text: Good white bulb and works well with smarthings. No frills here though in particular changing color temperature. On/off/dimmer. Use in my closets, over the sink, and tactical places where I just want it to last a long tine and be efficient.
customer_reviews.author: B. Nadreau

customer_reviews.title: Good bulb. Smart function gone
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 60 days. Still work great as bulbs but wireless/smart capability is gone.
customer_reviews.author: WyldPrairie

customer_reviews.title: Great connected bulb
customer_reviews.text: Love having the ability to set a light schedule for when I’m out of town. Or to just be able to login and turn it on with an app if my camera catches someone lingering.
customer_reviews.author: jce

customer_reviews.title: Unsure
customer_reviews.text: None of the features work without a HUB and the HUB cost $60-$150. I tried another type and it didn’t connect. Once I get the correct HUB I’ll update review to be fair
customer_reviews.author: MaxxedOut

customer_reviews.title: Great connected bulb, nice light and no noise/hum when dimmed.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these connected led lights along with a cheap Wink hub on sale and they work great. I have 12 bulbs all over the house on all 3 floors and they connect through some significant walls/floors. They have a nice bright soft while light for indoors, they make no noise even when dimmed, barely get warm and look just like a regular bulb.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sixpack

customer_reviews.title: But when it does work it works great.
customer_reviews.text: I installed them outside, and wirelessly connected them to my Ring Doorbell using the Samsung hub so the lights turn on when the doorbell detects motion. Sometimes however they do not turn on. Not sure where the blame lies. Probably the internet connection. But when it does work it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good reliable zigbee based bulb
customer_reviews.text: I've got a few of these bulbs and I'm a fan. They work great with Smartthings and are very responsive (quick).
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Worked just as expected
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly as expected right out of the box. Connected to Wink hub in seconds. One note: I bought this Cree bulb along with the comparable GE Link version. The Cree bulb is very lightweight and feels like a toy, but gives a nice even light. The plastic diffuses the light well..
customer_reviews.author: Fran Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: Full Spherical Light
customer_reviews.text: Best smart bulb for full spherical light ... most others have the hard plastic base, so the light shines upward and outward only. However, the Cree bulbs radiate light from the whole spherical bulb, even back toward the base. Only issue was pairing with the Amazon Echo Plus (with Zigbee hub): one bulb was instantaneous, but the other required 10 resets across 3 different sockets until it connected.
customer_reviews.author: JDC

customer_reviews.title: Smart home requirement!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, works outside, dims, and it does not Humm at all. I use wink and this is solid as far as connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive white spectrum bulbs, works with Alexa/Echo (with hub)
customer_reviews.text: Works with the SmartThings hub (and Amazon Alexa/Echo products) and were super easy to set up. These aren't glass, so less breakable and heavy. Great way to add smart home bulbs at an affordable price. They only do shades of white, but most of our lights are using a white spectrum.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Very bright, fairly easy to install and setup in smart things, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Very bright, fairly easy to install and setup in smart things, good price.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Not a good solution for Hue Bridge / HomeKit dual users.
customer_reviews.text: This bulb works with Hue bridge and Alexa, however because of an issue populating the device information in Hue's iOS app, specifically the model number field. You cannot effectively sync Hue bridge data on the light with HomeKit. This makes this bulb a no go for people who want to use both Hue bridge 2.0 and HomeKit in iOS. Alexa, Android, and Hue exclusive users should be ok as the bulb can be added both via serial number and via nominal device discovery in Phillips Hue app.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Hockle

customer_reviews.title: Nic color. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy with this and I can be fussy about the color of LED bulbs. Wireless control and dimming work well. It took some effort to get these to pair with my Smartthings hub but that was likely a problem with the hub, not the bulb and Smartthings has issued an update that is supposed to address this.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Gross

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting and super easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I can’t recommend Cree highly enough and I don’t know why I don’t hear more about these. Bought my first Cree connected about 2 years ago, and currently have about 10. None of them has needed replacement yet. They were all very easy to set up. So easy, in fact, that I don’t even remember setting them up. They also work effortlessly with both Google Home and Amazon Alexa. It’s also fun to discreetly turn them off and on, annoying loved ones.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Rosenkranz

customer_reviews.title: Great color and light output.
customer_reviews.text: These pair very easily with Smartthings. They also pair with Philips Hue if you know the trick.
customer_reviews.author: River City

product_meta.title: Cree BA19-08027OMF-12CE26-1C100 Connected 60W Equivalent Soft White (2700K) A19 Dimmable LED Light Bulb, Works with Alexa
product_meta.description: The Cree connected LED bulb looks and lights even more like a light bulb and can be controlled from anywhere. It is an easy-to-use and cost-effective way to customize lighting in your home. Simply install your bulbs and compatible hub, sync with the applicable app and begin to control your light settings using your iOS or Android device. Compatible with multiple home automation systems, the Cree connected LED bulb works with either wink or a ZigBee certified hub. Once installed, you can easily dim or brighten to the perfect setting, Schedule lights to come on automatically at the start of the day, or turn on lights for added security when you are away from home, all from the Palm of your hand.
feature_bullets: Dimmable LED light bulb for indoor use only

Can be paired directly with Alexa devices with built in ZigBee smart home hub (Echo Plus, Echo Studio, Echo Show – 2nd Gen only). Works with other ZigBee hubs (sold separately - Wink, SmartThings, WeMo)
Simply install your bulbs & compatible hub
62 watt equivalent LED bulb provides an omnidirectional all-around light source
The Cree Connected LED bulb shines bright for more than 22 years (25,000 hour rated life)

specifications.Warranty Description: 3-year limited warranty, see packaging for details.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars579 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
